hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a neutral regime (50-70% confidence) with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a break below the 20-day Bollinger Lower Band on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to bear regime with 85% probability within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed volatility often precede directional breaks. Low volatility indicates indecision; a volume-backed break below support suggests institutional selling and regime change initiation. Current regulatory uncertainty (MiCA, UK consultations) increases sensitivity to technical breaks.
entry_conditions: Daily close below 20-day Bollinger Lower Band

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Middle Band

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals fail to establish sustained bear regime (BTC down <3% over next 10 days) or immediately reverse above Bollinger Middle Band.
